intro: Elaphoglossum fuscum, commonly known as the dark fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Dryopteridaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that typically have a dark green color with a leathery texture. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Elaphoglossum fuscum produces small, spore-bearing structures called sori on the underside of its fronds. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and conservation efforts in suitable habitats.
